definitions.definition: The forcible inclusion or entry of an external group or individual ; the act of intruding .
examples: She viewed sales calls as an unwelcome intrusion .

definitions.definition: Magma forced into other rock formations; the rock formed when such magma solidifies.
A structure that lies within a historic district but is nonhistoric and irrelevant to the district.
The insertion of a phoneme into the pronunciation of a word despite its absence from the spelling. (e.g. intrusive r )
An involuntarily arising idea or memory that is nuisant and falsifies an accurate impression of the world.

main_definition: The forcible inclusion or entry of an external group or individual ; the act of intruding .
secondary_definitions: ( geology ) Magma forced into other rock formations; the rock formed when such magma solidifies.
A structure that lies within a historic district but is nonhistoric and irrelevant to the district.
( phonology ) The insertion of a phoneme into the pronunciation of a word despite its absence from the spelling. (e.g. intrusive r )
( psychology ) An involuntarily arising idea or memory that is nuisant and falsifies an accurate impression of the world.
